channel.title: Latest News from Liverpool FC
channel.description: The latest news from Liverpool FC

item.title: LFC Facebook Xmas competition
item.description: One fan is going to win over 20 great prizes this Xmas. Could it be you?

item.title: Carling Cup ticket notice
item.description: After our thrilling victory at Stamford Bridge on Tuesday night, Liverpool Football Club would like to announce that tickets for the Carling Cup semi-final home leg tie will be on sale next week.

item.title: Vote for Anthony Nolan
item.description: Anthony Nolan has been shortlisted to become the Football League's Official Charity Partner for the 2012-13 season but they need your help.

item.title: Craig gets your vote
item.description: Craig Bellamy was Liverpool's star man during our brilliant Carling Cup win at Chelsea, according to fans who voted in our online poll.

item.title: Vote for Player of the Month
item.description: Liverpool were unbeaten during November with two fantastic away wins at Chelsea, but who stood out for you? It's time to vote for your Standard Chartered Player of the Month.

item.title: Video: 60 minutes with Razor
item.description: Neil Ruddock discussed cup final heartache, Eric Cantona's shirt and why LFC was a special time in his life during a sixty minute chat with LFC TV recently - watch the full video online now.

item.title: Reds awaiting semi-final draw
item.description: The draw for the semi-finals of the Carling Cup takes place on Sky Sports tonight (Wednesday).

item.title: Carra: I'd love to get there
item.description: Jamie Carragher has set his sights on a first appearance at new Wembley after helping Liverpool secure a 2-0 triumph at Chelsea in the Carling Cup.

item.title: Kelly: I can score more
item.description: Martin Kelly helped fire Liverpool into the semi-finals of the Carling Cup with his first goal in red against Chelsea - and then declared: 'I can score more'.

item.title: Sterling and co out to tame Wolves
item.description: Rodolfo Borrell is hoping his young side can continue their excellent league form when they take on Wolves at Telford United tonight (7pm).
